result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Corey W Vike was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and written approval of agent & IID.
$250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $692 paid in full from bond.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo.

records.addlTxt:
Based on financial information provided to the Court by the defendant, the Court has found that the defendant's household income is no more than 150% of the federal nonfarm poverty guideline.
Therefore it is Ordered that an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) shall be installed and maintained for 50% of the normal costs.

Status conference on August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. tomorrow.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $2500.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
